Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with experience in the Insurance sector?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a “Data Solution Lead” to join a leading pharmaceutical company based in Belgium. As the Data Solution Lead, you will be responsible for gathering relevant information related to physical assets in order to analyse them and make appropriate, fact-based decisions.




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your duties as the Solution Lead will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:

1. Identify business needs, translate them into analyst requirements, and transform them into reports.

2. Communicate and simplify technical language for stakeholders, guiding them through new concepts such as data owner, data steward, and life cycle.

3. Identify necessary data and display it in comprehensive reports.

4. Conduct technical assessments and identify potential risks.




ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

To be successful in your application to this exciting role as the Data Solution Lead, we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:

1. Relevant degree in a related field.

2. Extensive industry experience in a similar role.

3. A working knowledge and practical experience with SAP analysis, problem-solving, and data analytics.

4. Knowledge of Power BI




Key Words:

Solution Lead / Pharmaceutical / Data Analysis / SAP / Technical Assessments / Risk Identification / Business Needs / Data Steward / Data Owner / Power BI / Hybrid Role




Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from anyone who meets the role requirements. HRS exclusively supports the STEM sectors, combining recruitment expertise with scientific knowledge to help you advance your career.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Supporting all Franchises (Medical Care / Dermo-Cosmetics & Personal Care), the Data Analyst is a key Business Partner for the General Management. The position is based in Brussels.


Main Responsibilities

  • Data analysis and reporting: Maintain and update existing dashboards (weekly and monthly) to ensure stakeholders have real-time access to key business metrics.
  • Improve, simplify, standardize, and automate existing dashboards, reports, and KPIs.
  • Identify inefficiencies in reporting processes and propose innovative solutions for improvement.
  • Ideally, leverage scripting (e.g., Python, SQL) to streamline data extraction, transformation, and automation of manual processes.
  • Business Development Support: Collaborate closely with stakeholders to monitor and enhance brand/portfolio performance (e.g., market share, sell-in/sell-out analysis).
  • Analyze channel performance, providing insights into the effectiveness of various sales and marketing channels (pharmacies, e-commerce, direct-to-consumer).
  • Ad hoc and Corporate Projects :Act as the go-to analytical resource for ad hoc requests from sales and marketing teams.
  • Design and develop new dashboards to meet evolving needs, using advanced tools like Tableau.
  • Collaborate with HQ and business teams to ensure data accuracy, proper integration of systems, and alignment of analytics initiatives with business goals.


Profile

  • Education : Master’s degree in data analytics, statistics, business engineering, computer science, or a related technical field;
  • Languages : Fluent in French and English; knowledge of Dutch is a plus;
  • Strong proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI);
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, with advanced Excel skills;
  • Knowledge of ERP systems (preferably Dynamics AX) and CRM platforms (preferably VEEVA);
  • Familiarity with ETL tools and processes such as Alteryx;
  • Ideally knowledge of SQL for database querying; experience with scripting languages such as Python;
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive and solution-oriented mindset;
  • Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in data handling and reporting;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and team player;
  • Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment;
  • Stress resistant, ability to meet and establish tight deadlines;
  • Problem-solver with “can-do” mentality, able to both pragmatically define solutions and capture and understand all relevant details when necessary;
  • Ability to analyze vast amounts of data;
  • Ability to see the big picture while focusing on the process and procedures necessary to produce deliverables.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keystone Solutions is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team of consultants. This dynamic position involves providing expert data analysis support to a client organization as part of Keystone Solutions consultancy services. As a Keystone consultant, you will tackle critical projects, working closely with our client to drive data-driven decision-making and deliver actionable insights. This role offers a unique opportunity to grow your expertise across diverse challenges, supported by Keystones robust professional development programs.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:


Data Collection & Preparation: Gathering, cleansing, and organizing data from various sources to ensure high-quality inputs for analysis.
Analysis & Insights Generation: Applying statistical techniques and analytical tools to extract meaningful patterns and insights that support business objectives.
Visualization & Reporting: Creating clear and compelling data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Collaboration with Stakeholders: Partnering with client teams to understand their data needs and translate findings into actionable recommendations.
Process Improvement: Identifying inefficiencies in current data processes and recommending solutions for optimization.
Support for Strategic Initiatives: Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Requirements:

To excel in this role, you should have:


Education: A Bachelors or Masters degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
Familiarity with database management and ETL processes.

Analytical Abilities: Strong quantitative skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Experience: 4+ years in a data analytics role, preferably with exposure to diverse industries or projects.


Why Join Keystone Solutions as a Consultant?


Diverse Client Projects: Work on varied and challenging assignments across industries, enhancing your professional expertise.
Professional Growth: Access to Keystone Solutions continuous learning programs, certifications, and mentorship opportunities to support your career ambitions.
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence in delivering solutions to clients.
Impactful Work: Play a pivotal role in transforming client operations through data-driven strategies and actionable insights.
Career Advancement: Build a strong foundation for long-term career growth within the consultancy realm, with opportunities to lead complex projects over time.



About Keystone Solutions:

Keystone Solutions is a leading consultancy firm specializing in delivering high-impact solutions to our clients. We pride ourselves on fostering a supportive environment where our consultants thrive while solving real-world challenges. As a Keystone consultant, you will represent our values of excellence, integrity, and innovation at every client engagement.

Ready to advance your career as a Keystone Data Analyst Consultant? Apply today and take the next step in a rewarding consultancy journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities




Our client in the private banking sector is looking for a Data Analyst to join their dynamic IT squad. The team consists of two developers and two analysts working collaboratively on data and digital projects. They leverage cutting-edge technology to deliver innovative solutions in asset management, partnering closely with business colleagues to provide high-quality services for both internal stakeholders and external institutional clients. The team is young, hands-on, and dedicated to achieving exceptional results.







Your Missions:




Act as a bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Understand and document stakeholder business requirements.
Conduct thorough analysis to define functional requirements that align with business objectives.
Engage with various departments to gather input and ensure alignment.
Create detailed documentation, including user stories, use cases, and functional specifications.
Collaborate closely with developers to clarify requirements and ensure accurate software design.
Develop test plans, write test cases, and perform functional testing to ensure quality.







Profile




At least 2 years of experience in software development as a business, functional or test analyst.
Strong foundation in writing use cases and business requirements, process modeling, SQL and overall testing knowledge.
Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, TestRail, Postman, DBeaver.
English fluency, both written and spoken, is an absolute must.
Knowledge of the financial services industry, particularly asset management, is a significant advantage.
Knowledge of Data Warehousing is a plus




Soft Skills: Pro-active & autonomous, Hands-on, Problem-solver, Team player




Offer




• Start date: ASAP.

• Homeworking: 2 days per week and 3 days in the Brussels office.




Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.







About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.




What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances …).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream

Soft Skills: Pro-active & autonomous, Hands-on, Problem-solver, Team player


Offer


• Start date: ASAP.

• Homeworking: 2 days per week and 3 days in the Brussels office.


Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.



About Dynafin Consulting


DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.


What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances …).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Le business des produits financiers (leasing, crédits, assurances) vous intéresse ?

Le secteur automobile et les défis futurs de la mobilité vous passionnent?

Vous avez déjà une première expérience dans le monde financier ?

Vous recherchez un nouveau défi et vous désirez exercer un job vous permettant d’exploiter pleinement vos talents en matière d'analyse financière ?

Dans ce cas vous êtes peut-être notre futur(e) collègue !




Stellantis Financial Services est la société financière des marques Peugeot, Citroën et DS, Opel , Fiat, Alpha Romeo,Abarth, Fiat Professional, Jeep, Maserati, construite en Joint-Venture avec la Banque Santander et présente dans plus de 10 pays Européens.

Nous proposons une large gamme de produits de financement dédiés à la mobilité : leasing, renting, crédits, assurances, ainsi que toute une gamme de services associés.

Nous accompagnons le développement des ventes de véhicules de nos marques via notre réseau de distribution.

(*) Stellantis est devenu le 4ème groupe mondial dans le secteur automobile et rassemble 14 marques automobiles




Votre fonction :

Création, analyse , communication et présentation des rapports en interne ainsi qu’en externe.
Plan d’action pour résoudre les problèmes liés aux diverses activités de la banque.
Communication aux autres services des risques liés à leur activité.
Contrôle de la performance de toutes les activités d’un point de vue risque même si celles-ci ne sont pas en lien direct avec le risque.
Production des chiffres des clôtures mensuelles.
Création du budget.
Réalisation des prévisions fin de mois
Piloter le risque de la banque et contrôler la performance vis-à-vis du budget .
Participation à la mise en place des différents projets liés au Risk.
Relation avec les audits internes et externes.
Responsable du risque opérationnel et polyvalence avec les autres fonctions du risque
Effectuer le traitement, l'exploitation et intégration des données dans un data warehouse (SAS)




Votre profil :

Master en ingénierie ou en mathématique
Excellente connaissance d'Excel
Connaissance du programme SAS souhaitée
Travailler sous la pression des délais
Equilibre entre esprit d'équipe et autonomie
Bilinguisme français-anglais




Nous vous proposons :

Travailler chez Stellantis Financial Services , c’est intégrer une société à taille humaine, mais aussi un groupe leader dans le secteur automobile, qui vous offre l’opportunité de de vous épanouir professionnellement et développer vos talents




Un environnement de travail centré sur l’automobile mais aussi la finance
Un environnement de type PME : familial, convivial, circuit de communication court, managers d’équipe accessibles et disponibles.
Un package complet avec avantages extra-légaux tels que chèque-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation…
6 jours de réduction de temps de travail sur base annuelle.
La possibilité de rejoindre des petites équipes soudées, motivées et compétentes qui favoriseront votre apprentissage et votre intégration.
Une évolution de carrière possible au sein des groupe SFS et Santander.
De nouveaux bureaux situés à Haren/Bruxelles avec parking et facilement accessibles en transport en commun
Show more

Title: Internship Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Student Empowerment Program as a Marketing Data Analyst Intern!

What is the added value of our internship program?


Be a part of the SE community: Meaningful and connected experience guided by a Program Leader and a Business Mentor.
With us, learn every day: Dedicated learning path combining business and soft skills training
Evolve in the BeNe cluster: Enhance collaboration and networking in an international environment


Where?

At Uccle, in Brussels, Belgium.

Duration?

3-6 months (depending on your school convention) - Ideally starting in February or September 2025!

What will be your mission?

As an intern, you will support our team by analyzing data to drive strategic decision-making and improve marketing and sales effectiveness. You will work with various data sources to provide insights, create reports, and assist in the development of data-driven marketing and sales strategies.

Here's how your internship could look like...


Data Collection & Management: Spend time each day gathering and analyzing data from various sources such as SalesForce,
Data Analysis: Analyze marketing performance metrics to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Reporting: Create regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and performance metrics to the marketing/sales team and stakeholders.
Campaign Support: Assist in measuring and evaluating the effectiveness of campaigns, providing insights to optimize future efforts.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, offer management, and marketing, to ensure data accuracy and alignment on performance objectives.


Learning Experience:


Gain hands-on experience in data cleaning techniques to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data you collect.
Understand how to interpret the data and translate it into actionable insights.
Provide insights based on your analysis to help optimize future sales/marketing efforts.
Develop your problem-solving skills as you tackle diverse analytical challenges.


What student are we looking for?


Fluent in French/English or Dutch/English
Master’s or Bachelor's degree, preferably in Marketing, Statistics, or Economics
Ability to work independently.
Strong analytical skills
Proficient in Excel and data visualization tools (like Tableau or Power BI).


What about our recruitment process?


An exchange with the recruiter
An exchange with your tutor


Ready to Take the Next Step?

At Schneider Electric we believe in fostering a culture of growth and innovation. When you join us, you'll be part of a supportive and collaborative team that encourages your professional development. We provide comprehensive training and mentorship to help you excel in your role. If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with us and make a real impact in the world, apply now to join our team! Together, let's create a brighter future and unlock your full potential at Schneider Electric! We are thrilled to receive your application and are looking forward to reviewing it!

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pourquoi vous choisirez AG




Un lieu de travail où vous pouvez prendre des initiatives. Où tout le monde vous encourage à montrer ce dont vous êtes capable. Et où vous construisez l’avenir avec vos collègues. Vous avez de l’audace et le client est au centre de vos préoccupations ? Alors, à très bientôt chez AG !




Et si c’était votre prochain job ?

Data Intelligence est une équipe bien rodée au sein du département Non-Vie d'AG. Nous nous engageons à fournir un service client exceptionnel et des solutions de qualité innovantes à nos clients. Afin de renforcer notre équipe, nous recherchons un ou une Data Analyst qui marie talent, motivation, business mindset et solides affinités avec le domaine de analytics.




Responsabilités clés :




Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes du marketing et des départements opérationnels afin d'exploiter le potentiel d'utilisation des données externes dans le cadre des processus et des activités du business.
Vous coopérez étroitement avec les parties prenantes du marketing et des départements opérationnels pour exploiter les capacités en matière de Machine Learning et d'IA (générative) dans le cadre des processus et des activités du business.
Vous collaborez avec des équipes transversales pour concevoir, proposer, motiver, évaluer les bonnes solutions en matière de données, établir des proof of concepts et des pilotes utiles pour le business.
Vous contribuez avec le département informatique à garantir l'industrialisation des solutions dans notre système, en respectant les exigences du business, en assurant entre autres les livraisons liées aux exigences, le suivi et les activités de test.
Vous assurez le suivi du projet, communiquez avec les supports appropriés aux différentes parties prenantes et aux différents niveaux de management sur l'état d'avancement, les réalisations, les risques, etc.




Vous vous reconnaissez dans ce profil ?




Vous avez un Master dans une filière quantitative (statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, économie, commerce) ou un domaine connexe où l'analyse de données joue un rôle prépondérant.
Vous avez de l'expérience en gestion de projet, en analyse de données, en business intelligence ou en analyse business.
La connaissance de SQL ou d'autres compétences en matière de données est un avantage.
Vous êtes capable d'assurer la mise en œuvre d'initiatives fondées sur des données.
Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et un sens critique aiguisé.
Vous savez faire preuve de créativité.
Réfléchir en termes de processus ne vous pose aucun problème.
Vous avez d'excellentes capacités de communication, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit.
La qualité est essentielle à vos yeux.
Vous aimez collaborer (au sein de l'équipe et au-delà).
Sens de l'initiative et proactivité sont autant de cordes à votre arc.
Vous maîtrisez le français et le néerlandais.
Vous avez une certification en gestion de projet ? Vous marquez des points.




Vous n'allez pas rater ça ?




Un super job chez le leader sur le marché de l'assurance. Et comme nous cherchons à encore mieux servir nos clients, nous comptons sur vous pour nous y aider.
Un environnement de travail moderne dans tous les sens du terme: physique, digital et organisationnel. En d'autres termes, des heures de travail flexibles, la possibilité de télétravailler jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine et le matériel IT adéquat pour travailler de la maison.
Une équipe enthousiaste et dynamique, notée 10/10 pour l'ambiance et la convivialité.
La possibilité de vous perfectionner en continu, grâce à un large éventail de formations. Idéal pour apprendre toutes les compétences qui vous aideront à faire évoluer votre carrière.
Une véritable carrière. En effet, travailler chez AG, c’est bien plus qu’un job. Envie d’explorer de nouveaux horizons après quelque temps ? Nous vous guidons et vous encourageons à exploiter tous vos talents à fond.
Des bonnes vibrations, grâce à un vaste programme de bien-être bourré d'activités sportives et d'ateliers inspirants. De quoi vous sentir (encore) plus épanoui(e) dans votre travail et votre vie.
Et comme l’argent, ça compte aussi : un package salarial attrayant. Vous pouvez même composer vous-même une partie de votre package, car personne ne sait mieux que vous ce dont vous avez besoin.




Lancez-vous !

Totalement emballé(e) ? Appuyez le bouton et postulez dès aujourd’hui.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 Breng data tot leven en maak impact!




Wil jij de spil zijn in het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen binnen een innovatieve organisatie? 🌟 Als Data Analyst krijg jij de kans om data om te toveren tot krachtige inzichten die onze business naar een hoger niveau tillen. Dit is jouw kans om jouw analytische scherpte, technische vaardigheden en talent voor communicatie in te zetten en écht het verschil te maken. 💡




Als Data Analyst ben je onmisbaar in onze organisatie. Jij:




Implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagementoplossingen die het gebruik van data en rapportages optimaliseren. 📈
Visualiseert data met tools zoals Tableau of Power BI en vertaalt complexe data naar begrijpelijke inzichten. 📊
Analyseert en modelleert data om waardevolle inzichten te leveren voor strategische keuzes. 📚
Waarborgt de kwaliteit van onze data door middel van testing en het opstellen van een data quality beleid. ✅
Adviseert en ondersteunt de organisatie bij het maken van data-gedreven beslissingen. 🧠
Stimuleert innovatie door het toepassen van AI en Machine Learning in onze rapportage- en analyseprocessen. 🤖




Waarmee kan jij ons team versterken?

Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring met datavisualisatietools (zoals Tableau of Power BI). 💻
Je hebt kennis van data-analyse en -modellering en bent bekend met AI en Machine Learning.
Je bent communicatief vaardig en kunt complexe inzichten vertalen naar begrijpelijke taal voor stakeholders. ✨
Je bent proactief, innovatief en gedreven om het beste uit data te halen. 🔍
Je kan je vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands, Frans en Engels.
Je hebt kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira.




What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.




We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, bonus, vergoedingen, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Show more
HTML:
📊 Breng data tot leven en maak impact!


Wil jij de spil zijn in het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen binnen een innovatieve organisatie? 🌟 Als Data Analyst krijg jij de kans om data om te toveren tot krachtige inzichten die onze business naar een hoger niveau tillen. Dit is jouw kans om jouw analytische scherpte, technische vaardigheden en talent voor communicatie in te zetten en écht het verschil te maken. 💡


Als Data Analyst ben je onmisbaar in onze organisatie. Jij:


  • Implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagementoplossingen die het gebruik van data en rapportages optimaliseren. 📈
  • Visualiseert data met tools zoals Tableau of Power BI en vertaalt complexe data naar begrijpelijke inzichten. 📊
  • Analyseert en modelleert data om waardevolle inzichten te leveren voor strategische keuzes. 📚
  • Waarborgt de kwaliteit van onze data door middel van testing en het opstellen van een data quality beleid. ✅
  • Adviseert en ondersteunt de organisatie bij het maken van data-gedreven beslissingen. 🧠
  • Stimuleert innovatie door het toepassen van AI en Machine Learning in onze rapportage- en analyseprocessen. 🤖


Waarmee kan jij ons team versterken?

  • Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring met datavisualisatietools (zoals Tableau of Power BI). 💻
  • Je hebt kennis van data-analyse en -modellering en bent bekend met AI en Machine Learning.
  • Je bent communicatief vaardig en kunt complexe inzichten vertalen naar begrijpelijke taal voor stakeholders. ✨
  • Je bent proactief, innovatief en gedreven om het beste uit data te halen. 🔍
  • Je kan je vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands, Frans en Engels.
  • Je hebt kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira.


What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.


We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.


Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, bonus, vergoedingen, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
For a good client, we are looking for a BI Analyst.

As a BI Analyst, you play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the company. You'll collaborate with different departments to translate their needs into clear reports and dashboards.

In partnership with external experts, you'll ensure the data model evolves alongside our business processes. You'll also be responsible for the continuous development of the Azure data warehouse, keeping it aligned with the latest technological advancements. Clear documentation will be a critical part of your role to ensure all stakeholders can make the most of our data infrastructure.

Who are you?

You hold a degree in IT or have equivalent experience.
You are fluent in French or Dutch, with a good command of the second language.
You have excellent analytical and communication skills.
Proficiency in SQL, DAX, Power BI, and data modeling (Kimball) is essential.
You have at least 3 years of experience developing and implementing BI solutions.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, and Azure Synapse is a plus.

What does they offer you?

A competitive salary with additional benefits like a company car, meal vouchers, and group insurance.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth through various training programs and specializations.
A dynamic work environment with a family-oriented culture that emphasizes collaboration.
Flexible working hours, remote working options, and 12 extra vacation days, ensuring a healthy work-life balance.

Apply now and join the team as a BI Analyst!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Finance
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions?

Are you passionate about transforming data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions? We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst Finance to join our team and help shape the future of financial reporting and analytics. You will play a key role in collecting and analyzing data from various sources, creating interactive dashboards, and providing actionable insights to our Finance department and beyond.




As a Data Analyst in Finance, you will help the team navigate large datasets, build impactful Power BI reports, and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. You'll also act as a key liaison between the Finance department and other teams to ensure the smooth execution of digital transformation projects.




Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:​

Design and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, serving the needs of the Finance department, both for Financial and Business Reporting.
Collaborate with Finance teams to gather requirements and translate them into actionable Power BI development needs.
Conduct user testing to ensure reports are effective and meet end-user expectations.
Troubleshoot issues, address inquiries, and resolve technical challenges within the Finance data environment.
Document the development of data models and reports to ensure sustainability and best practices.
Lead and manage Power BI development projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with quality standards.
Promote data management best practices and foster a culture of data stewardship within the Finance team.
Drive digital transformation projects and work with the Finance department to integrate new digital tools and technologies.
Lead efforts to continually improve the Planful system and collaborate with the HQ Finance Data Analytics Team.




How does our ideal candidate look like?

Bachelor’s degree in information technology (or related field) with at least 5 years of experience in a financial data role.
Expertise in Power BI (SQL, Power Query, Data Modelling, DAX, Visualizations).
Knowledge of SAP, SAP BW, Data Bricks, Planful, and Alteryx is a plus.
Familiarity with data architecture, ETL processes, machine learning, and data science concepts.
Experience in financial analysis and modelling.
Strong problem-solving, communication, project management, and change management skills.
A critical, open mindset with a passion for driving innovation in data solutions.




Performance by design. Caring by choice.™

We want to be the place where people want to work. That’s why we particularly focus on safety, mutual respect, integrity and a performance-driven environment. To be the employer of choice, we offer:

Career Growth

We offer exciting career opportunities, whether you want to grow within your function, extend your knowledge across different levels or would like to grow into a managerial role.

Engaging Culture

We continue to build a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where diversity of thought is valued.

Well-Being

The well-being of our employees is essential to our success. We encourage a healthy lifestyle and offer amenities such as ergonomic work areas and social activities.

Generous Compensation & Benefits

We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including extra-legal benefits like insurance plans, safety incentives, vouchers, annual bonus and additional holidays.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT, de l’ingénierie et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans, notamment en 2024 où les Extiens se hissent à la première place du palmarès Best Workplaces France !

Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay
Show more

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Description de Poste : Analyste Qualité des Données (Secteur de l'Énergie)

Lieu : Gosselies




Contexte

Ce poste soutient la transition du secteur de l'énergie vers une gestion axée sur les données, avec un focus sur :

Analytics : Rapports stratégiques et tableaux de bord KPI.
Gouvernance des Données : Mise en place de politiques de gestion des données.
Qualité des Données : Amélioration de l'exactitude, complétude et cohérence des données.

L'Analyste contribuera à la qualité des données via des actions proactives et correctives.




Responsabilités :

Analyse des Données : Comprendre le paysage des données, documenter structures et anomalies.
Qualité des Données : Définir des règles, identifier les causes des anomalies, proposer des solutions.
Suivi et Reporting : Suivre les KPI, détecter les anomalies, générer des rapports.
Documentation : Centraliser les règles, partager recommandations et solutions.
Promotion de la Qualité : Sensibiliser les équipes.
Outils et Automatisation : Utiliser Python, Power BI, Atacama DQ, et développer des solutions automatisées.




Profil Recherché :

Formation : Diplôme en informatique, data ou équivalent.
Expérience : 2 à 5 ans en qualité des données (secteur énergie, un plus).
Compétences :
Compréhension métier-données.
Autonomie et bonne communication.
Résolution pragmatique et curiosité technologique.
Techniques : Python, MS Excel, Power BI, et Atacama DQ

Show more

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.




SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis




Qualifications:

You hold a master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.




We offer:

A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group




If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

Title: Accounting Data Analyst
Description:
Gentis is a Belgian recruitment company headquartered in Brussels and providing permanent staffing as well as project sourcing solutions worldwide in multiple sectors.




For our client an company based in the surroundings of Brussels, we are looking for an Accounting Data Analyst in the Financial Services sector.




Tasks:




Performing in-depth data analyses (inventories, balances, reconciliations]
Modelling new process steps in Standard Operating Procedures (including process flows & service levels agreement)
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy, quality and adherence to established standards for the purpose of data migrations
Preparing and presenting comprehensive reports and data visualizations to stakeholders, providing insights that drive decision making




Requirements:




Knowledge in Banking and Asset Management with strong focus on Accounting
Proven experience in Data Analysis and Process Modelling, including strong expertise in data crunching and process modelling techniques
Fluent in English, French and/or Dutch are great assets
Solid organizational autonomy and multi-tasking skills

Title: Customer Digital Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Digital Analyst with foundational knowledge of data analysis and a keen interest in digital customer data. This role is designed for individuals with limited experience (1–2 years) who are eager to learn, grow, and contribute to impactful projects. You will assist in data preparation, visualization, and reporting while receiving mentorship from senior analysts to build your skills in analytics and customer journey insights.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:


Assist in setting up analytics tracking, such as page views and event tracking (e.g., button clicks, scroll depth), working closely with technical teams
Assist in gathering, cleaning, and processing data for analysis, including handling missing values and validating datasets.
Analyze data and contribute to identifying actionable insights for improvement.
Support in building dashboards and reports, ensuring they meet customer needs - using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Sheets.
Support senior analysts on small parts of larger projects to gain hands-on experience.
Participate in workshops to define KPIs and assist in data-related discussions.


What We Expect:

To succeed in this role, you should have:


1–2 years of experience in data visualization or analysis using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or QlikSense.
A bachelor’s degree in economics, marketing, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
Basic understanding of customer data analysis and statistics.
Some knowledge of digital analytics and customer journey with tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, ContentSquare or Hotjar).
Strong eagerness to learn and develop advanced skills in data analytics.
Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to collaborate in a team environment.
Excellent organizational skills, accountability, and attention to detail.
Proficiency in English, with knowledge of Dutch or French being an asset.


What we have to offer:


A full-time job
Working directly with a client on their side and in an international environment
You will join a young, flexible and dynamic scale-up focused on data-driven marketing strategy & solutions
You will be part of a team managing challenging customer data projects for large international organisations
You will have the opportunity to develop your skills & knowledge in a challenging and fast-growing domain. Where needed you will be guided & trained by senior experts.
Frequent training & education is provided, regarding latest data technologies or innovative analytics use cases

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re not just a venture builder—we’re creating purpose-driven, evidence-led organizations that set the pace for tomorrow’s most impactful industries. Our mission is simple: transform powerful ideas into high-growth, scalable startups that challenge conventions and drive positive change. Operating with an evolutionary approach, we foster flat hierarchies and decentralized decision-making, empowering each venture to evolve independently while staying aligned with our core values of agility, transparency, and purpose.




What We Do

We specialize in building ventures from the ground up, guiding concepts through rigorous validation, rapid development, and scalable growth. Our adaptive, plug-and-play infrastructure ensures that each venture starts strong, while our decentralized framework allows them to scale autonomously. With a data-driven foundation, we prioritize evidence-based strategies and integrate cutting-edge tools, from AI-driven analytics to lean, modular tech stacks, positioning each venture for long-term success.




Our Approach

At our core, we believe in building high-growth organizations that are not only innovative but also sustainable and adaptive to change. Our approach is evolutionary: we embrace continuous improvement, empower decision-making at all levels, and design our ventures to be resilient in the face of change. Each project benefits from our global network of experts, access to competitive bidding for services, and a robust framework for data-led insights, creating ventures that are agile, scalable, and poised to lead in their fields.




Why Work with Us




Purpose-Driven, Evidence-Based: We’re dedicated to building ventures that create real impact, using evidence as our guiding star for every decision.
Decentralized & Empowering: With a flat hierarchy and decentralized approach, each venture enjoys autonomy and agility while staying connected to a powerful support system.
Innovative, Growth-Focused Ecosystem: Our plug-and-play infrastructure and agile methodologies ensure that every venture can scale quickly and sustainably.
Global Reach with Local Insight: Our network of experts brings a global perspective with nuanced local insights, creating ventures that succeed on the world stage while resonating locally.




Our venture builder isn’t just a company—it’s a purpose-driven platform that fosters decentralized, high-growth startups ready to reshape industries. Join us if you’re looking to shape the future and be part of a team that builds the organizations of tomorrow.




Global Benefits

Work Flexibility & Environment

Remote/Hybrid Work Options: Flexibility to work from home or the office, based on role and location.
Flexible Working Hours: Set your own schedule with core working hours.
International Working Environment: Collaborate with diverse teams from around the world.
Office Environment: Modern and well-equipped office space to enhance productivity.

Compensation & Financial Benefits

Competitive Salary & Benefits Package: Salary and benefits tailored to your location and experience.
Quarterly Bonus: Additional cash bonus available when the company achieves record-breaking revenue.
Tax Optimization Benefits: Options for tax-efficient compensation.

Health & Well-being

Mental Health Support: Access to OpenUp for mental health resources and support, available to everyone.
Flexible Health Benefits: Customize health benefits to best meet your needs.

Learning & Development

Professional Development Programs: Opportunities for continuous growth and upskilling.
Learning and Development Budget: Dedicated funds to pursue courses, certifications, or workshops.
Global L&D Training: Access to training sessions organized by the global Learning & Development team.
Coaching Sessions: Personalized coaching to support your career and personal growth.
Language Classes: Language learning options to support international collaboration.

Team Building & Culture

Company Retreats and Team Building Days: Regular events to build strong connections with colleagues.
Team Trip Budget: Allocated budget for team trips to foster stronger team dynamics.
Company Anniversary Celebrations: Join in celebrating milestones and achievements together.




Ideawise is an Equal Opportunity Employer

It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, marital or parental status, or religion.




We want to ensure that all applicants have a fair and equal chance, so we’re using a TestGorilla assessment (https://www.testgorilla.com). This minimizes unconscious bias in our hiring process. Successful candidates will be invited to a job interview.




Ready to join our team?

Start by clicking the link below. https://app.testgorilla.com/s/3lbgwsqn

Are you passionate about digital analytics and eager to make an impact? We're looking for a talented Digital Analytics Professional to join our Client's team! This is your chance to analyze customer behavior, uncover business insights, and shape the future of websites and apps.

Provide valuable business insights and detect trends in user behavior

Title: Strategic Insights Analyst
Description:
ECO3 is a leading global supplier of prepress systems to the printing industry. Commercial, newspaper and packaging printers rely on us for the most extensive range of integrated solutions, from printing plates and computer-to-plate systems over workflow and print management software to pressroom chemicals. Our solutions are designed to deliver higher productivity, lower costs and greener outcomes at every stage of the print process.




We are a company with a positive mindset and a ‘can do’ attitude, continuously striving for excellence. ECO3 is headquartered in Belgium with production centers in Germany, Brazil and China. We are commercially active worldwide through sales organizations and dealers in more than 30 countries.




You print. We care.




We are seeking a Strategic Insights Analyst, a high-potential professional who will work closely with senior management and the leadership team. This role is designed for someone eager to contribute to strategic initiatives that drive growth and operational excellence within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior managers and the management team on key strategic projects, focusing on transformation and restructuring efforts to enhance operational effectiveness and long-term value.
Conduct thorough analyses to support decision-making processes, identifying opportunities for improvement and innovation in business operations.
Assist in project management activities, ensuring that timelines, budgets, and objectives are met through effective coordination and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Participate in brainstorming sessions and workshops, contributing fresh ideas and insights that align with the company’s growth strategies.
Support the implementation of change management initiatives, helping teams adapt to new processes and systems introduced during transformation projects.
Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for senior leadership, summarizing findings, recommendations, and project updates.
Foster a collaborative team environment, building strong relationships across departments and promoting a culture of continuous improvement.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in transformation and restructuring, bringing innovative ideas to the team.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of professional experience in consulting or industry, with a focus on operations, restructuring, or strategic initiatives.
Demonstrated experience in project management and teamwork, with a track record of successful collaboration in dynamic environments.
Strong analytical skills with a results-oriented mindset and the ability to approach complex problems logically.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively conveying ideas and insights to diverse audiences.
A well-developed sense of responsibility and a strong commitment to achieving high-quality outcomes.
A passion for driving growth and delivering exceptional change within organizations.
An entrepreneurial spirit, characterized by initiative, creativity, and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities.




Key Competencies:

Strategic thinking and the ability to analyze and synthesize complex information.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with a focus on building productive relationships.
Excellent organizational skills, capable of managing multiple projects and priorities effectively.
High levels of accountability, with a commitment to delivering results and making a positive impact.




Why Join Us? As a Strategic Insights Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior leaders on high-impact projects that shape the future of our organization. This role offers a unique chance to develop your career in a supportive environment where your contributions will be valued and recognized. If you are passionate about driving change and looking to make a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Job Description

Als toonaangevend telecommunicatie- en entertainmentbedrijf heeft Telenet meer dan 7 miljoen klantinteracties, 100 interne Telenet- en BASE-vestigingen in België en meer dan 1500 medewerkers die in een klantgerichte functie werken. Hierdoor beschikken we over een zeer diverse databeschikbaarheid binnen de hele organisatie (bv. klant-, product- en interactiedata).

Binnen Customer Operations zijn we op zoek naar een ambitieuze Data Analyst die fulltime onze Operations Tribes voedt met data. In deze rol maak je deel uit van ons Customer Operations Data Steering Team. Daar zullen we data gebruiken om onze Telenet, BASE & back-office collega's te ondersteunen, te inspireren en uit te nodigen met inzichten, duidelijk verstaanbare rapportering en aanbevelingen.

De belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheid van ons team is om Customer Operations bij te staan in de plannen en ambities richting interne en externe stakeholders. Dit doen we door rust, duidelijkheid en voorspelbaarheid te integreren met behulp van data.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Als Data Analyst

  • Drijft de analyse van grotere data en inzichten, onderwerpen en tracks over de 6 verschillende Operations Tribes (Telenet, BASE, Back Office, Billing, Customer Innovation & Platform, Steering);
  • Begrijpt de bedrijfsvraag (-vragen) en vertaalt deze naar data vereisten;
  • Creëert de nodige data queries om ervoor te zorgen dat de gegevens op de meest correcte manier worden verzameld om analyses uit te voeren;
  • Vertaalt data analyse in een visueel aantrekkelijk PowerPoint-deck dat een hoog niveau van data storytelling heeft;
  • Bepaalt de beste visualisaties en bouwt vervolgens kwalitatieve rapporten;
  • Presenteert inzichten aan het Operations management om ervoor te zorgen dat de volledige waarde van de analyse wordt vastgelegd.

Wat We Te Bieden Hebben

  • Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf dat volop in je investeert en je werkomgeving optimaal aanpast aan wat jij nodig hebt. Zo kun je je ontwikkelen en een goede balans tussen werk en privé behouden. Wat gooien we nog meer in de strijd?
  • Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om na een tijdje op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
  • Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten boekt en je stempel drukt.
  • Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van voordelen (bv. thuiswerk, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, telefoonabonnement, kortingen op Telenet producten, smartphone, mobiliteitsbudget ...).
  • Het fijne gezelschap van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.

Onze Ideale Data Insights Analyst

  • Master in Business Engineering, Toegepaste Economie, Computerwetenschappen, Informatiemanagement... of gelijkwaardig door ervaring;
  • Ervaring in Telecom, Entertainment, Consulting of gelijkaardige industrieën is een pluspunt;
  • Ervaring in data analyse en in staat zijn om zelf data te capteren;
  • Kennis van een rapportagetool is een pluspunt;
  • Sterk inzicht in kwantitatieve analyse en gestructureerde probleemoplossing;
  • Je kan een analyse end-to-end coördineren met het te bekomen resultaat voor ogen, rekeninghoudend met veelvoorkomende valkuilen;
  • Uitstekende presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden. Jij kan belangrijke stakeholders overtuigen;
  • Een goede kennis van het Nederlands en Engels is essentieel.

Title: Consultant Power BI
Description:
Mission:




Notre client recherche un Power BI Expert pour renforcer son équipe IT et participer activement au développement du centre de compétence Power BI. Le rôle consiste à collaborer étroitement avec les départements métiers afin d’améliorer les modèles de données, optimiser les flux de données et gérer les rapports au sein de l'entreprise. Vous serez en charge de l’adaptation de l’architecture des systèmes Power BI en fonction des exigences corporate et des besoins spécifiques des différents départements (Ressources Humaines, Finance, Marketing, etc.).

Responsabilités principales :

Développement et amélioration des modèles de données et des flux de données sur Power BI
Gestion des licences et déploiement du service Power BI dans de nouveaux départements
Création de rapports et tableaux de bord pour le management des capacités, les finances, etc.
Adaptation de l’architecture et de l’infrastructure Power BI en fonction des contraintes de l’entreprise
Collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins et y répondre de manière optimale

Profil recherché :

Minimum 3 ans d'expérience dans l'utilisation et le développement avec Power BI
La gestion de projet est un plus
Solides compétences en gestion de données et en création de rapports
Capacité à travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour répondre à leurs besoins spécifiques
Bonnes compétences en communication et en gestion des priorités

Conditions :

Poste basé en présentiel avec 1 jour de télétravail par semaine possible
Durée : 12 mois
Début souhaité : dès que possible, début 2025




Si vous êtes passionné par Power BI et souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique pour un projet stratégique, n'hésitez pas à postuler !

Title: Performance & Data Analyst F/M
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Job title

Performance & Data Analyst F/M

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.

This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.

It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.

Responsabilities


You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.



Profile


You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges
You master MS Excel; Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus
You are fluent in English, French or Dutch





Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

6-10 years

Languages


English (C1 - Fluent)
French (C1 - Fluent)
