Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Company Description

We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a member of Netcompany Group A/S, and a leading European IT Solutions and Services company with a strong international presence and expertise, dedicated to responsible digitalisation. We offer innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of public and private organizations, while being a key player in the EU Institutions for the past 30 years. We hold an outstanding record of 500+ organizations in 70+ countries, that have chosen our solutions and services, to fulfil their business needs. Our team of 3500+ professionals is our driving force and our most valuable asset.

Job Description

Are you ready to discover the role of a Power BI Specialist in Netcompany-Intrasoft?

As a Power BI Specialist You Will


Build and maintain business intelligence data models and dashboards for our IT applications, according to the priorities given by project managers.
Integrate data from multiple sources.
Create visuals for workflow, distribution, and consumption using Power BI tools.
Build new BI dashboards based on change requests.
Provide evaluative and corrective maintenance to existing BI dashboards.
Address requests received via the Change Advisory Board & Follow the schedule agreed upon with IT unit officials.


Qualifications

What would make you a fit for the role:


Master’s degree with a minimum of 10 years of experience, or a Bachelor’s degree with at least 14 years of experience.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Power BI, Kibana, QuickSight, DAX Query, SQL, Python, M Query, Power Query).
Experience in Power BI data modeling and ETL, both on-premises and in the cloud.
Experience in Power BI report performance optimization (e.g., query folding, visual optimization, data model minimization).
Familiarity with Power BI administration, including gateways, user/report access, and workspaces.
Knowledge in integrating various data sources into Power BI (e.g., relational databases, JSON, website analytics).
Experience with GitLab or similar version control tools.
Strong analytical skills to translate complex data into actionable visualizations.


Additional Information

Being a part of the Netcompany-Ιntrasoft team, you will be provided with:


The opportunity to work in a modern environment.
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Hospitalization plan
Hybrid working model
Meal and commuting allowance
Well-being activities (on premises)
Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings)
A personalized development plan for targeted career growth


If you are looking forward to be part of a diverse environment, and have the opportunity to work alongside well-experienced professionals, on challenging, large-scale projects that directly impact millions of citizens around the globe, then this is the place to be!

By joining Netcompany – Intrasoft Belgium, you will be an integral part of a distinguished team of 600+ tech enthusiasts working for international projects, primarily within the European Institutions market. Whether you're collaborating with clients on their premises or harnessing the power of cutting-edge technologies at our own facilities, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of digital services in an environment that values your ideas and fosters your growth.

Our culture

Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://netcompany.com/careers/greece/our-values/

#BePartOfSomethingGreat!

Please submit your CV in English. All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Should you be invited for an interview and be considered suitable candidates for the EU project at the first stage, we inform you that your CV may be forwarded to the relevant European Organization or third companies - consortium members participating in the specific EU project together with NETCOMPANY INTRASOFT for evaluation.

We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. As part of the Netcompany-Intrasoft culture, we respect human rights and focus on creating a positive workplace, where all employees are valued, and where diversity and inclusion are a vital part of our our everyday working experience.

Excellent communication and coordination skills.

Title: Data Analytics Training & Internship
Description:
Refonte (Refonte AI) is a leading IT corporation globally recognized for its expertise in providing top-notch IT and Ed-tech services. Specializing in digital marketing, data science, data analytics, UI-UX design, web development, and app development, we are dedicated to innovation, excellence, and empowering talents worldwide.




Learn More: https://refontelearning.com/




Job Summary:




Refonte Technology is offering a chance for eager individuals seeking to master Data Analytics from basic to advanced levels, all while engaging in real-world projects across the globe. Our program is structured to provide a flexible work setting, allowing participants to collaborate with a diverse global team spanning Oceania, Asia, Europe, and the Americas.




Projects You Will Work On:




Excel project: Visualize hospital dataset using Excel

Statistical project: Analyze live stock price data to study company stock behavior.

EDA case study: Apply EDA techniques in risk analytics for minimizing lending risk.

Bike-sharing system analysis: Examine bike-sharing data and usage patterns.

IPL data analysis: Analyze data from the Indian Premier League cricket tournament.

Data findings communication: Present summarized results and key insights from projects.

Global movie release: Plan to release a movie globally in 2024 by RSVP Movies.




Roles & Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with our esteemed data science experts to collect, clean, and analyze extensive datasets, honing skills in data preprocessing and visualization.

- Utilize machine learning and data mining techniques to extract insights from large datasets, including Excel interface structure identification. ·

- Apply Python programming skills for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) in real business scenarios, focusing on risk analytics in banking and financial services. ·

- Design scientific tests and optimize model performance using the latest modeling technologies like no-code databases and data mining.

- Collaborate with a team of experts to build machine learning pipelines for diverse use cases in commerce, financial markets, and procurement.

- Work with internal stakeholders to explore and understand business data, formulate hypotheses, and measure the impact of strategies using techniques like T-tests.

-Solve specific challenges and develop innovative solutions by adapting modeling technologies like bike share systems.

-Learn and apply complex analytical techniques using tools like Tableau.

- Prepare reports and presentations to effectively communicate data analysis processes and results.




Qualifications:

- Currently pursuing any degree showcasing a strong commitment to continuous learning and professional growth.

- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, vital for effective collaboration and articulation of complex ideas.

- Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a cohesive team, highlighting adaptability and strong teamwork capabilities.




Note:




This position is part of our unpaid “Data Analytics Training and Intern” under Refonte Technology. Upon application, our team will contact you to proceed with the application details and joining process.




Learn More: https://refontelearning.com/




Location:

Remote, European Union




Thank you for considering Refonte Technology for your professional development in the field of data analytics. We look forward to welcoming you to our dynamic team.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant (NL + ENG)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Business Intelligence Consultant

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Consultant to guide organizations in leveraging data to make strategic decisions. This role involves designing dashboards, analyzing trends, and creating actionable reports.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements;
Design and develop BI solutions, including dashboards and data models;
Perform data analysis to identify key performance insights;
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across BI tools;
Train users on BI tools and data interpretation.



Requirements:


Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence
Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.);
Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques;
Ability to understand and interpret business needs;
Experience with ETL processes and data integration;



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data and technology and the role they play in driving sustainable business decisions? Do you care about transparency when it comes to sustainability reporting?

Join our Datashift team as an ESG Data Analyst and help shape the future of our fast-growing ESG domain.

Datashift is a fast growing consultancy team with a focus on delivering solutions that answer business questions with data and facts. As part of our expanding ESG team, you’ll help leading companies modernize their approach to sustainability and ensure transparency in their impact.





Your Rol

eAs an ESG Data Analyst, you will

:Partner with clients to design, implement, and deliver cutting-edge ESG data and reporting solutions
.Support companies in creating value by ensuring transparent and impactful sustainability reporting
.Work across a variety of industries, including Automotive, Banking & Financial Services, Insurance, and Life Sciences

.We’re looking for someone with

:A Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Industrial Sciences, Business, or a related field
.3-5 years of experience in Data Analytics, Business Process Optimization, or Technology Integration
.A strong understanding of business processes and ESG indicators (e.g., carbon emissions, energy consumption, water usage, waste management, and governance practices)
.English is required. Proficiency in Dutch or French is a plus

).Cross-functional collaboration skills especially with IT and business team




s.

es.
Our o

eam;A no-nonsense working environment with a focus on high qual
ity;Excellent terms of employment (including company car, fuel card, meal vouchers & bon

its.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Ben je een gedreven consultant met een passie voor data en BI? Wil je jouw technische vaardigheden in Power BI inzetten om schaalbare dataoplossingen te ontwikkelen? En sta je graag mee aan de wieg van een nieuwe business unit? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!




Wie zijn wij?




Organi is actief op de markt sinds 1977 en is een gevestigde waarde in de IT-sector. We zijn expert in sectorspecifieke totaaloplossingen: business software en IT-services. Na een samenwerking met een externe partner hebben we besloten om zelf intern een business unit BI & AI te ontwikkelen, zodat we onze klanten nog beter kunnen ondersteunen met innovatieve en flexibele oplossingen.




Wie ben jij?




Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring met Power BI, inclusief het bouwen van geavanceerde rapporten en dashboards. Ervaring met andere BI-tools zoals Tableau en Qlik is een plus.
Je hebt een professionele achtergrond in business intelligence, data science of een relevant vakgebied. Ervaring in onze sector is een troef.
Je hebt een goede kennis van DAX en bent ook goed onderlegd in data modeling, visualisatie en reporting.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatie-, presentatie-, analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.




Hoe zal jouw werkdag als Power BI Consultant eruitzien?




Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en beheert geavanceerde Power BI-rapporten, je verbetert datastromen en je creëert inzichtelijke en bruikbare dashboards voor klanten. Samen met je collega’s tweak je deze dashboards en reports op die manier dat ze voldoen aan de specifieke wensen van de business.
Je bent medeverantwoordelijk voor het verzorgen van data en transformeert ze in intuïtieve dashboards die rechtstreeks door klanten worden gebruikt.
Je werkt nauw samen met diverse teams binnen de organisatie om hun databehoeften te begrijpen, de logica te implementeren en te vertalen naar bruikbare inzichten.
Je past best practices toe op het gebied van datavisualisatie en gebruikerservaring.
Je implementeert automatische systemen voor datamonitoring en datakwaliteit.
Je denkt actief mee na over procesverbeteringen en efficiëntie en draagt actief bij aan de verbetering van data governance en kwaliteitsnormen binnen onze organisatie.
Je hebt een sleutelrol in het bevorderen van een datagedreven cultuur binnen het bedrijf.




Wat heeft Organi jou te bieden?




Een aantrekkelijke verloning aangevuld met mooie voordelen: bedrijfswagen, laptop, flexibel werken, thuiswerk, 6 extra vakantiedagen, anciënniteitsverlof, groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques & groepsbonus.
Een uitdagende en afwisselende job, want je werkt voornamelijk voor Organi, maar bent inzetbaar voor de ganse groep. Dit betekent dat je betrokken bent binnen de verschillende bedrijven voor diverse projecten en klanten waar je geregeld ook ter plaatse zal gaan.
Mogelijkheden voor professionele groei en ontwikkeling.
Een dynamische en stimulerende werkomgeving met een open en informele cultuur.
De kans om deel uit te maken van een innovatief en datagedreven team.
Last but not least: een groep van 150 Belgische en Nederlandse collega’s en veel fun tijdens onze extra activiteiten!

Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Data Analist
Description:
Be part of our beating heart

Brussels Airport veut être connu comme l'un des meilleurs aéroports du monde, un pôle économique entièrement connecté pour les personnes et les entreprises, et comme le cœur battant de l'Europe, où les clients, l'innovation et la durabilité occupent une place centrale. Voulez-vous contribuer à façonner l’aéroport d’aujourd’hui et celui de demain ?

Alors, arrêtez d’en rêver et lancez-vous au sein de notre équipe Technology & Infrastructure dans le rôle de Data & Analytics Data Analist!

Ce Que Vous Allez Réaliser Chez Nous

Préparation des activités Data & Analytics (D&A)


Préparer et organiser les activités d'analyse et d'architecture des données pour construire et déployer des solutions D&A. Ces solutions fourniront des insights opérationnels, tactiques et stratégiques à l’entreprise, permettant ainsi la prise de décisions et d’actions basées sur des faits.
Agir en tant que coach et agent de changement pour accompagner l’évolution de l’entreprise vers une organisation pilotée par les données (Insight Driven Organisation).



Tâches liées à la préparation des activités D&A :


Affiner, challenger et résumer l’essence des demandes business et des questions de science des données pour garantir la construction des solutions BI adaptées ou la livraison des données nécessaires.
Estimer le temps et l’effort requis pour vos activités, afin qu’ils puissent être intégrés dans les budgets et les plannings.



Analyses de données, solutions D&A et structures de données:


Réaliser des analyses de données ponctuelles et concevoir, développer, tester et publier des solutions D&A (rapports, analyses ponctuelles, développements DWH, etc.).
Assister à l’intégration de nouvelles solutions dans l’environnement de données existant et fournir la documentation requise.
Fournir les données dans des structures adaptées pour soutenir les Data Scientists.



Résolution de problèmes dans les solutions D&A existantes et reporting périodique :


Analyser et résoudre les problèmes des solutions D&A existantes afin de garantir leur bon fonctionnement.



Formation Et Support


Former et soutenir les utilisateurs finaux dans l’utilisation des solutions fournies et l’interprétation des informations/insights, afin de maximiser leur valeur ajoutée et de développer progressivement les compétences D&A au sein de l’entreprise.



Ce Qui Vous Distingue


Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master (de préférence en Informatique, Sciences de l’ingénieur, Ingénierie commerciale, Sciences économiques appliquées, Mathématiques, ou Ingénieur industriel) ou équivalent par expérience.
Vous avez au minimum 3 ans d’expérience pertinente en tant qu’analyste (business, fonctionnel ou data).
Vous avez une excellente maîtrise du néerlandais, de l’anglais et du français.
Vous disposez d’une vaste connaissance des domaines suivants :
Techniques d’analyse (business, fonctionnelle, data, etc.).
Concepts BI (DWH, DM, ODS, etc.).
Techniques de modélisation des données (data vault, dimensionnelle, etc.).
SQL et outils front-end (idéalement Tableau).
Connaissances en architecture de données.
Vous maîtrisez les méthodologies de développement agile (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
Vous avez une bonne vision conceptuelle permettant de traduire les processus métier en modèles de données selon les directives et la méthodologie en vigueur.
Connaissances des processus, de l’organisation, des systèmes ICT et des données dans un ou plusieurs sous-domaines (par exemple, Commercial, Expérience Passagers, Finance, RH, District d'Affaires de l’Aéroport, Cargo & Logistique).



Ce qui fait battre nos cœurs

Chez Brussels Airport, vous travaillez dans un monde à part, plein de nouvelles opportunités et de défis passionnants. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement unique et inspirant qui donnera des ailes à vos talents.

Une expérience unique en son genre ! Nous travaillons dans notre nouveau bâtiment Compass, doté d’une vue imprenable, qui permet de travailler ou collaborer de manière à la fois hybride et flexible, équipé comme il se doit, et où vous pouvez compter sur un package attrayant d'avantages extralégaux les plus recherchés par les employés. En outre, nous évoluons dans un environnement durable: nous nous déplaçons en vélo, en bus ou en voiture électrique et nous avons même notre propre gare. Que demander de plus ?

Vous sentez votre pouls s'emballer ?

Vous avez hâte de vous surpasser au sein de Brussels Airport Company ? Envoyez rapidement votre CV et votre lettre de motivation via le lien ci-dessous. Qui sait, nous pourrions très bientôt vous accueillir dans notre aéroport animé au cœur de l'Europe !

D'autres questions ? N'hésitez pas à contacter florence.van.enst@brusselsairport.be

Classe de fonction: C

Une expérience unique en son genre ! Nous travaillons dans notre nouveau bâtiment Compass, doté d’une vue imprenable, qui permet de travailler ou collaborer de manière à la fois hybride et flexible, équipé comme il se doit, et où vous pouvez compter sur un package attrayant d'avantages extralégaux les plus recherchés par les employés. En outre, nous évoluons dans un environnement durable: nous nous déplaçons en vélo, en bus ou en voiture électrique et nous avons même notre propre gare. Que demander de plus ?

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Jouw uitdaging




Mediafin, de uitgever van onder andere De Tijd en L’Echo, zoekt een nieuwe Audience Data Analist om de redactie te ondersteunen bij de digitale strategie.




Je maakt deel uit van de redactie en bent het aanspreekpunt voor inzichten over het leesgedrag.
Je weet data-analyses op een toegankelijke en bruikbare manier te vertalen voor de redacties.
Je werkt nauw samen met het digitale distributieteam om de digitale distributiestrategie van onze journalistiek naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
In samenwerking met de data-analisten van het team lezersmarkt zet je complexe data om in strategische inzichten, maar je vindt ook in een handomdraai een antwoord op concrete cijfervragen over onze nieuwsbrieven, pushnotificaties, social media of website en app.
Je stuurt mee de ontwikkeling van de juiste tools en oplossingen aan om beter te kunnen voorzien in de data-behoeften van de redacties.




Jouw profiel




Je bent in staat data nauwkeurig te interpreteren en om te zetten in aanbevelingen die in lijn zijn met de noden en doelstellingen van onze redacties.
Je hebt ervaring met data-analyse en bent gebeten door digitale media.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring op een nieuwsredactie en kent de dynamiek die er leeft.
Je bent actiegericht met een scherp strategisch inzicht.
Je bent proactief en communicatief. Je kan complexe cijfers vertalen naar concrete inzichten en oplossingen.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van Excel; kennis van analytics tools (o.a.QlikSense en Metabase) en SQL is een meerwaarde.
Je bent een teamplayer en gaat heel vlot in overleg.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands en een goede kennis van het Frans, of omgekeerd.




We bieden je




Bij Mediafin kom je terecht in een succesvol mediabedrijf. Innovatie, ambitie en ondernemingszin maken deel uit van ons DNA. Talent vormt de kern van wie we zijn. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling, een fijne werksfeer en een aangename werkomgeving op de bruisende site van Tour & Taxis.

Show more

Title: Customer Digital Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic Junior Digital Analyst with foundational knowledge of data analysis and a keen interest in digital customer data. This role is designed for individuals with limited experience (1–2 years) who are eager to learn, grow, and contribute to impactful projects. You will assist in data preparation, visualization, and reporting while receiving mentorship from senior analysts to build your skills in analytics and customer journey insights.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:


Assist in setting up analytics tracking, such as page views and event tracking (e.g., button clicks, scroll depth), working closely with technical teams
Assist in gathering, cleaning, and processing data for analysis, including handling missing values and validating datasets.
Analyze data and contribute to identifying actionable insights for improvement.
Support in building dashboards and reports, ensuring they meet customer needs - using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Sheets.
Support senior analysts on small parts of larger projects to gain hands-on experience.
Participate in workshops to define KPIs and assist in data-related discussions.


What We Expect:

To succeed in this role, you should have:


1–2 years of experience in data visualization or analysis using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or QlikSense.
A bachelor’s degree in economics, marketing, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
Basic understanding of customer data analysis and statistics.
Some knowledge of digital analytics and customer journey with tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, ContentSquare or Hotjar).
Strong eagerness to learn and develop advanced skills in data analytics.
Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to collaborate in a team environment.
Excellent organizational skills, accountability, and attention to detail.
Proficiency in English, with knowledge of Dutch or French being an asset.


What we have to offer:


A full-time job
Working directly with a client on their side and in an international environment
You will join a young, flexible and dynamic scale-up focused on data-driven marketing strategy & solutions
You will be part of a team managing challenging customer data projects for large international organisations
You will have the opportunity to develop your skills & knowledge in a challenging and fast-growing domain. Where needed you will be guided & trained by senior experts.
Frequent training & education is provided, regarding latest data technologies or innovative analytics use cases

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
Job Description

At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
itsme® has fundamentally changed how people lead their digital lives in Belgium, but we are not stopping there! Do you want to be a driving force to help expand on this success story as part of a talented team that is making a positive impact on society? Then keep on reading, you’ll probably like what you’ll see.




We are itsme®, one of Europe’s fastest-growing scale-ups, counting 75 team members and growing. Our mission: providing a state-of-the-art digital identity solution to all people, enabling them to interact securely in the digital space. Now, only seven years after being founded, 7 million citizens use the itsme® app, to identify themselves and sign documents online. Starting in Belgium, we successfully launched the itsme® app, in 16 European countries, with the ambition to become an internationally leading player.




We are looking for a motivated and ambitious professional to join our Business Operations team in a role with real impact. Working closely with leadership and management, you’ll play a key part in shaping the strategic direction of one of Belgium’s most exciting scale-ups.




This is a unique opportunity to leverage your expertise to deliver meaningful insights that will guide critical decisions, empower our business teams, and drive our growth as we expand internationally. If you’re passionate about turning data into action and contributing to a fast-growing, forward-thinking company, we’d love to hear from you!




What your job looks like

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you’ll play a key role in translating data into actionable business insights that drive strategic decisions. That will include the following responsibilities:




Needs gathering: Collaborate with business stakeholders (sales, marketing, finance, HR and product) to understand their function-specific needs. For example, the revenue and marketing teams require actionable insights into our customer base and marketing activities to shape our go-to-market strategy and identify growth opportunities.
Data querying and modelling: Extract and process data from databases and business applications (such as Hubspot, Salesforce and Google Analytics) to deliver insightful analyses. This might involve leveraging SQL to extract and manipulate data from our data lake.
Analysis and reporting: Turn your analyses into actionable visual dashboards using tools like PowerBI. Present findings to stakeholders, highlighting key trends and actionable insights.
Data structuring and integrity: Maintain and optimize our applications needed in terms of data lake, data analytics and reporting infrastructure to ensure data integrity across reports. In doing so, you will be supported by the Business Operations Manager and your Business Intelligence and tech infrastructure colleagues.
Process Improvements: Proactively drive improvements in our data and reporting strategy by recommending improvements to tools, processes and reporting methods.




Whom we are looking for

You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
You have 2-3 years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analysis, data management, or a similar role.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent) and proficiency in SQL (querying, data manipulation, performance optimization).
Ability to understand and translate business needs into data-driven solutions. Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with various departments and external vendors.
Familiarity with scripting and programming languages such as Python or R to conduct more advanced analysis, automate processes, and derive deeper insights when needed.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and cloud data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud).
You thrive in a dynamic and fast-growing environment, where you go the extra mile to get things done.
You are fluent in English and bilingual in Dutch or French.




What we offer

A unique opportunity to be a key pillar and gain wide exposure in a fast-moving and high-growth environment.
The chance to further develop and grow in a fun and dynamic team.
Offices in Brussels and flexibility in terms of remote working.
A fixed contract with an attractive compensation package.




Show more

  • A unique opportunity to be a key pillar and gain wide exposure in a fast-moving and high-growth environment.
  • The chance to further develop and grow in a fun and dynamic team.
  • Offices in Brussels and flexibility in terms of remote working.
  • A fixed contract with an attractive compensation package.

Title: Performance & Data Analyst F/M
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Job title

Performance & Data Analyst F/M

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.

This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.

It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.

Responsabilities


You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.



Profile


You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges
You master MS Excel; Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus
You are fluent in English, French or Dutch





Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

6-10 years

Languages


English (C1 - Fluent)
French (C1 - Fluent)

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
Nexeo is currently seeking an IT Functional Analyst - Senior for a leading financial institution in Brussels.




About Nexeo Belgium:

We are a consultancy firm that supports clients in the banking, finance, and insurance sectors throughout all stages of their transformation projects—from business consulting to IT solution implementation.




As a Nexeo consultant, you will benefit from:

An international environment with offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland, and Canada.
A growing team of over 450 employees.
Career opportunities in a company experiencing 20% annual growth.

IT Functional Analyst - Senior – Main Responsibilities:

Analyze and define business models using techniques like UML, Visio, and mock-ups.
Understand and document end-to-end (E2E) process and data flow.
Challenge business requirements in terms of technical feasibility, risks, and limitations, proposing alternative solutions.
Collaborate with architects on technical solutions, including APIs.
Review and understand code (Visual Basic, Python, SQL) to ensure smooth integration.
Facilitate end-to-end testing, ensuring the quality of deliverables.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate needs into functional requirements.
Manage risks, constraints, and impediments to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.

Profile:

Master's degree or equivalent experience.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in a Functional/Business Analyst role, preferably with knowledge of fraud.
Proficient in conceptual modeling (UML, Visio, mock-ups), MS Office, and understanding of IS and testing.
Familiar with coding languages like Visual Basic, Python, and SQL.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies is a plus.
Strong communication skills in Dutch, French, and English.

Skills:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Structured, detail-oriented, and quality-focused.
Self-driven and capable of working autonomously while being a strong team player.

Working for Nexeo:

Hybrid work model: 50% on-site, 50% remote.
A dynamic and innovative working environment.
Opportunities for career development and growth.




#ITFunctionalAnalyst #FraudPrevention #Banking #Agile #BusinessAnalysis #Brussels #Consulting

Title: Data System Analyst
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Systems Analyst who is agile and innovative to join us in our Insight-to-Impact (I2I) Patient Impact Team, based at our Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium.

About The Role

The Data System Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that technical processes are set up and maintained optimally. Managing dataflows efficiently to establish a foundation for superior data quality. You will also be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data’s full potential.

Who You’ll Work With

You will work very closely with IT and Insights-to-Impact Teams, in areas of; reporting, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Advanced Analytics and Digital Business Transformation (DBT). You’ll also support technical and non technical colleagues.

What You’ll Do


Map out all the data flows across all systems (Veeva CRM, SalesForce Marketing Cloud, Denodo, Octopaï) and flag areas of improvement.
Understand all deliverables and business challenges (data quality, reporting) that Business Analysts, Reporting team, and Advanced Analytics teams are facing.
Work together with IT or Partners, to provide solutions that will address the problems in a fundamental way.
Define, implement, and monitor the solutions (corrective and preventive) being implemented.
Ensure data lineage across systems for better data governance.
Analyze the impact of new CRM releases on Qlik Sense and/or Power BI reports and propose solutions to minimize disruptions.


Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills


A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role, or in an environment where data analytics was your main scope, preferable in a sales and marketing environment (CRM, Advanced Analytics, Digital Assistant, DBT).
Pharma experience and working in an international environment would be advantageous.
Excellent understanding of API’s, Data Systems, System Architecture, and Data Warehouses (Snowflake, Denodo).
You are passionate about Data Analytics and have hands-on experience with data science tools.
Programming language experience (SQL, Python, or R) is required.
Entrepreneurial mindset to drive solutions.


Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst / Project Manager Intern
Description:
Want to create a positive impact through AI?




Founded as one of the first AI companies in Belgium with a mission to improve the world around us. We are believers in automation and efficiency, and we see Artificial Intelligence as a toolbox that will allow us to automate more of the growing list of tasks that no longer require human-level cognition.




We are a passionate team of machine learning engineers, software developers, devops engineers, business developers and project managers. At Sagacify you will find a startup environment with a great team spirit where you can bring ideas and take responsibilities in the areas you want to evolve in, regardless of your level of experience. We strive to work on innovative projects in a fun atmosphere, and remote work, flexible schedules or regular team events are part of our culture.




We are looking for skilled people and team players to join the adventure.




In short, your responsibilities :




Throughout your internship, you will collaborate closely with the IT Project Manager and actively contribute to various stages of projects. Your work will focus on the following areas :




Business analysis & testing :




Document existing processes with accuracy 
Participate in the development, description, and implementation of new processes
Conduct QA testing to validate the developments and ensure the highest level of quality within the defined business requirements




Project management & support :




Assist in project delivery by using project management tools, and identifying key project indicators
Support Start-IA projects at every stage (before, during, and after workshops) through note-taking, file tracking, data requests, report creation, and structuring deliverables such as business requirements and user stories
Prepare functional documentation, and contribute to client proposals and quotes
Collaborate with the IT Project Manager by discussing and challenging ideas, bringing a fresh perspective to the team




Process optimization :

Identify and understand the needs of the business and ensure that processes are clear, understood, and respected and recommend improvements




Skills & requirements :




Business analysis skills to understand and restitute client business concepts
Want to improve your communication skills but already base good basis
Fluent in French, and you have professional skills in English, any other language is a plus
Familiarity with Microsoft and Google applications and any project management tools (e.g. Kanban systems)
Excellent organizational & communication skills and ability to multitask 
High level of autonomy, integrity and passion for delivering quality work
Prior internship experience in consulting or client-facing roles is a plus
Master’s degree in Management, Project Management, Business Administration, Business Engineering, or related fields
Available for 3 to 9 months, starting as soon as possible




Why you will love working with us :




You'll be part of a team of enthusiasts who love to learn and develop skills in different areas and technologies. You'll work with the whole Sagacify team, in an environment tailored to your needs, with flexible working hours. Remote working is also part of our culture. 




Join us and contribute to the world of tomorrow by fast-tracking our customer’s AI journey in various industries. 




For more information, check this video to learn more about our working culture.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Orange Business Digital Services is looking for a Cloud Data Engineer to reinforce its Data intelligence practice. Are you passionate about data? Do you have a strong interest in development, data modelling, unit testing and, continuous deployment using the latest technologies related to Cloud solutions? If the answer is yes, you should probably keep on reading!




Your key areas of responsibility as a Data Engineer Consultant:




Using an analytical, data-driven approach to support business cases.
Working with clients and partners to design data processing systems, data pipelines and deliver insightful analytics while ensuring data integrity.
Taking part in the design and the modeling of Data Mesh and Data Warehouse solution
if you have a teaching streak, we will offer you the possibility to give trainings in our Data Academy.




As an ideal candidate you have:




A master’s or bachelor’s degree in IT, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
A strong interest in data manipulation (storage, crunching, pipeline implementation)
At least 3 years’ experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Azure, Google Cloud or AWS
Knowledge of Data Warehousing principles and modelling (Data Vault, Star-schemas, Slow Changing Dimensions, …)
A strong SQL knowledge
Fluency in English and you master Dutch or French fluently
Conceptual and creative thinking




It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:




Knowledge of at least one programming language: Java, C#, Python, Scala…
Knowledge of continuous developments / deployment concepts & technologies (GIT, Azure DevOps, Gitlab, CircleCI, ...)
Basic knowledge of scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell)
Knowledge of Unix environments




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:




Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.

Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist au sein du Service Budget, finances et monitoring (h/f/x)
Description:
Data Scientist au sein du Service Budget, finances et monitoring h/f/x

Iriscare - Office bicommunautaire de la santé, de l'aide aux personnes et des prestations familiales

1 poste vacant

Contrat à durée indéterminé



Contenu de la fonction

Vous disposez d’excellentes compétences analytiques ? Vous aimez travailler avec les chiffres et les données avec minutie et efficacité ? Vous êtes familiarisé avec Excel et PowerBi ? Vous avez des affinités pour la programmation ?

La fonction publique correspond-elle à vos valeurs ?

Iriscare a besoin de vous !

Vos tâches :


Vous êtes responsable du développement, du contrôle et de la gestion des données administratives et statistiques nécessaires pour mener à bien les missions du service et en rendre compte aux différentes parties prenantes... ;
Vous effectuez des analyses dans le domaine des différentes compétences d'Iriscare afin de fournir à l'institution, à l’autorité (de tutelle), aux tiers et aux citoyens une image précise des domaines de la santé, de l'aide aux personnes et des prestations familiales... ;
Vous collectez et interprétez des informations statistiques afin de les communiquer à des clients internes et externes... ;
Vous rédigez et collaborez à des publications (web) destinées à informer les parties prenantes (administrations publiques, chercheurs, groupes d'intérêt, population, etc.) dans les domaines de la santé, de l'aide aux personnes et des prestations familiales... ;
Vous adoptez une conduite solidaire et contribuez à une dynamique de groupe constructive.


Plus d’informations sur la fonction ? N’hésitez pas à contacter :

Jens Vandevelde - premier attaché Service budget, financement et monitoring

Tél. : 02/435.61.33

Pour votre information, Iriscare est fermé entre noël et nouvel an, n'hésitez pas à envoyer un e-mail nous nous chargerons de vous répondre à notre retour le 2 janvier.

Contrat, salaire et avantages

Contrat à durée indéterminée.

Salaire minimum sans expérience: 47.417,07 EUR brut annuel indexé. Votre ancienneté acquise dans le secteur public est d'office valorisée au prorata des prestations effectuées. L'ancienneté acquise dans le secteur privé ou à titre d'indépendant peut, quant à elle, faire l'objet d'une demande de valorisation, également au prorata des prestations effectuées, et ce, pour un maximum de dix années.

Avantages :


horaire flexible dans la prestation des 38h par semaine
sécurité de l'emploi
35 jours de congés annuels et 5 flexijours par an (à temps plein)
possibilité de télétravail (après 6 mois d'expérience dans la fonction)
assurance hospitalisation (conjoint et enfants y compris)
chèque-repas d’une valeur faciale de 8 EUR par jour presté
allocation de fin d'année
pécule de vacances
possibilités de suivre des formations durant les heures de travail
possibilité de bénéficier d’une allocation de bilinguisme
gratuité des transports en commun pour le trajet domicile-lieu de travail
accessibilité aisée via les transports en commun : proximité des métros Trône et Maelbeek et de la gare de Bruxelles-Luxembourg
possibilité de recevoir une prime pour les déplacements en vélo
accès à une plateforme pour des réductions attractives (Benefits at work)
accès à un service social


Plus d’infos sur le contrat/ les avantages? N'hésitez surtout pas à contacter :

Le Service RH :

Tel : 02/ 435 62 58

Pour votre information, Iriscare est fermé entre noël et nouvel an, n'hésitez pas à envoyer un e-mail nous nous chargerons de vous répondre à notre retour le 2 janvier.

Informations relatives à Iriscare

Iriscare est un organisme d’intérêt public (OIP) bicommunautaire devenu le point de contact privilégié pour les citoyens et les professionnels pour tout ce qui concerne la protection sociale en Région bruxelloise.

Les compétences gérées par Iriscare sont variées :


la reconnaissance et le financement des maisons de repos, des établissements pour personnes atteintes d’un handicap, des conventions de rééducation fonctionnelle mais également le financement des Initiatives d’Habitation Protégées et des Maisons de Soins Psychiatriques;
la gestion et le financement des mutualités et des caisses d’allocations familiales bruxelloises;
la caisse publique bruxelloise d’allocations familiales, Famiris;
l’octroi des autorisations pour les milieux d’accueil bruxellois bicommunautaires;
le soutien aux professionnels de la santé, particulièrement dans les maisons de repos et institutions pour personnes handicapées (y compris le personnel de soin intérimaire);
le financement des initiatives d’aide à la personne et, particulièrement, l’aide aux personnes âgées ou aux personnes atteintes d’un handicap;
l’octroi et le paiement de l’allocation d’aide aux personnes âgées (APA);
la détermination, sur base de différents critères, du degré de handicap ou de perte d’autonomie d’une personne, mais également des implications au niveau social, médical ou psychologique de celui-ci.


Iriscare se soucie des questions environnementales et de son impact sur la société dans son ensemble et sur le long terme. L'Office a par ailleurs reçu, en 2023, le label Entreprise Eco Dynamique (3 étoiles) ce qui signifie que l'institution est un modèle d'entreprise éco-dynamique et est exemplaire en termes de management environnemental.

Iriscare a également obtenu en 2023 et 2024, le label "Great Place to Work".

L’emploi vacant se situe au sein du Service budget, financement et monitoring d’Iriscare. Le service compte 16 collaborateurs. Il est responsable de la comptabilité générale, de la gestion financière, du budget et des rapports financiers et statistiques. Suite à la 6e réforme de l'État, les institutions et les personnes sont financées à la fois directement et par l'intermédiaire des caisses d'allocations familiales et des organismes assureurs pour les secteurs des prestations familiales, des soins de santé et de l'aide aux personnes. Le service se charge également de la gestion effective des dossiers et du contrôle (des prix) pour les maisons de repos, les maisons de soins psychiatriques, les initiatives d’habitations protégées et les centres de rééducation fonctionnelle.

Plus d'infos sur Iriscare via http://www.iriscare.brussels/fr/.

Diversité, équité et inclusion

Iriscare a à cœur de promouvoir la diversité et l'inclusion et ce, tout en garantissant à tous et toutes l'égalité des chances et un traitement équitable. À ce titre, nos sélections sont basées sur les compétences sans faire de distinction sur l'origine, la couleur de peau, le sexe, l'âge, l'orientation sexuelle, le handicap, etc.

Vous êtes une personne en situation de handicap? Ou vous souffrez d'une maladie/d'un trouble de l'apprentissage? Faites-le nous savoir par e-mail afin que nous puissions, si votre candidature est retenue, procéder aux aménagements nécessaires à votre situation et ainsi vous permettre de participer à la procédure de sélection dans les meilleures conditions possibles.

La force de nos équipes réside dans les qualités de chacun.e de nos collaborateur/rice.s. C’est la diversité de nos équipes qui fait la force de nos services.

Profil recherché

Nous recherchons un collaborateur détenteur d'un diplôme de l'enseignement supérieur de type long (master).

La copie du diplôme ainsi que l'éventuelle équivalence de diplôme étranger doivent être transmises au plus tard à la date de clôture des candidatures. Pour plus d'informations à ce sujet, veuillez visiter ce site: Diplôme étranger ou dans une autre langue | Travaillerpour.be.

Exigences :


Posséder des bonnes connaissances en Excel et PowerBi.


La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.

Seules les candidatures répondant aux conditions requises dans l'offre d'emploi seront examinées dans le cadre de cette sélection.

Comment postuler?[1]

Votre lettre de motivation personnalisée et votre CV (+ copie du diplôme et équivalence éventuelle) doivent être envoyés pour le 10 janvier 2025 au plus tard

L'épreuve de sélection comprend une épreuve écrite (+- 60min) éliminatoire suivi par un entretien oral d'une durée approximative de 60 minutes devant un jury, sur base de la méthode STAR. Il vise à évaluer vos compétences par rapport aux exigences de la fonction (compétences génériques), ainsi que votre motivation, vos intérêts et votre affinité avec le domaine d'activité.

Les épreuves de sélection seront organisées en présentiel, à Iriscare, au 71/2 rue Belliard à 1040 Bruxelles.

Si le nombre de lauréats finaux est supérieur au nombre de postes vacants, une réserve de recrutement sera constituée dont la validité est de six mois.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter au 02/435 62 58 ou au 02/435 61 53 en cas de questions sur la procédure de sélection ou sur le contrat et les avantages.

[1] Iriscare traite vos données à caractère personnel en respectant la réglementation en vigueur applicable au traitement de données à caractère personnel et, en particulier, le règlement (UE) 2016/679 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 27 avril 2016 (ci-après, « le Règlement général sur la protection des données » ou «RGPD») et la loi du 30 juillet 2018 relative à la protection des personnes physiques à l’égard des traitements de données à caractère personnel.

Vos données à caractère personnel, transmises dans le cadre de cette offre d'emploi sont nécessaires au bon traitement de votre candidature et dans la mesure où cela est nécessaire pour vous contacter. Elles ne seront pas réutilisées à d’autres fins ni conservées plus longtemps que nécessaire.

Pour en savoir plus sur la gestion de vos données et de vos droits, veuillez consulter notre politique de confidentialité via : https://www.iriscare.brussels/fr/protection-donnees-personnelles
Show more

Profil recherché

Nous recherchons un collaborateur détenteur d'un diplôme de l'enseignement supérieur de type long (master).

La copie du diplôme ainsi que l'éventuelle équivalence de diplôme étranger doivent être transmises au plus tard à la date de clôture des candidatures. Pour plus d'informations à ce sujet, veuillez visiter ce site: Diplôme étranger ou dans une autre langue | Travaillerpour.be.

Exigences :

  • Posséder des bonnes connaissances en Excel et PowerBi.

La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.

Seules les candidatures répondant aux conditions requises dans l'offre d'emploi seront examinées dans le cadre de cette sélection.

Comment postuler?[1]

Votre lettre de motivation personnalisée et votre CV (+ copie du diplôme et équivalence éventuelle) doivent être envoyés pour le 10 janvier 2025 au plus tard

L'épreuve de sélection comprend une épreuve écrite (+- 60min) éliminatoire suivi par un entretien oral d'une durée approximative de 60 minutes devant un jury, sur base de la méthode STAR. Il vise à évaluer vos compétences par rapport aux exigences de la fonction (compétences génériques), ainsi que votre motivation, vos intérêts et votre affinité avec le domaine d'activité.

Les épreuves de sélection seront organisées en présentiel, à Iriscare, au 71/2 rue Belliard à 1040 Bruxelles.

Si le nombre de lauréats finaux est supérieur au nombre de postes vacants, une réserve de recrutement sera constituée dont la validité est de six mois.

N'hésitez pas à nous contacter au 02/435 62 58 ou au 02/435 61 53 en cas de questions sur la procédure de sélection ou sur le contrat et les avantages.

[1] Iriscare traite vos données à caractère personnel en respectant la réglementation en vigueur applicable au traitement de données à caractère personnel et, en particulier, le règlement (UE) 2016/679 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 27 avril 2016 (ci-après, « le Règlement général sur la protection des données » ou «RGPD») et la loi du 30 juillet 2018 relative à la protection des personnes physiques à l’égard des traitements de données à caractère personnel.

Vos données à caractère personnel, transmises dans le cadre de cette offre d'emploi sont nécessaires au bon traitement de votre candidature et dans la mesure où cela est nécessaire pour vous contacter. Elles ne seront pas réutilisées à d’autres fins ni conservées plus longtemps que nécessaire.

Pour en savoir plus sur la gestion de vos données et de vos droits, veuillez consulter notre politique de confidentialité via : https://www.iriscare.brussels/fr/protection-donnees-personnelles

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Warehouse Engineer (NL + ENG)
HTML:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Data Warehouse Engineer

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are hiring a Data Warehouse Engineer to design, build, and maintain our data warehouse infrastructure. The role requires expertise in ETL processes, data modeling, and ensuring data accessibility for analytics and business intelligence teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement data warehouse architecture to support business needs;
  • Develop and optimize ETL pipelines for efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading;
  • Create and maintain data models and schemas for the warehouse;
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency within the warehouse;
  • Collaborate with data analysts and BI developers to support reporting needs;
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data warehouse performance and scalability.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience in data warehousing and ETL development (3+ years preferred);
  • Proficiency in ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, SSIS) and SQL;
  • Experience with cloud-based data warehousing (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery);
  • Knowledge of data modeling techniques (Star Schema, Snowflake Schema);
  • Strong understanding of database and data warehouse concepts;
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.


What We Offer

  • DKV Insurance
  • Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
  • Continuous and personalized career progression support
  • Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
  • Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.


At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
One of my clients is seeking a Business Analyst for a long-term position. This opportunity provides a dynamic role with diverse responsibilities within a flat organizational structure.




Your Role:

Identify needs across various departments.
Collaborate closely with the IT team.
Utilize CRM and marketing automation tools.
Ensure follow-up on product and process development.




Your Profile:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently searching for an experience Data Scientist to join a valued client of mine within in the financial sector based in Brussels.




In this role, you will leverage your data science expertise to analyze complex datasets, build predictive models, and uncover insights that drive data-informed decision-making. This freelance opportunity is ideal for a data scientist who values flexibility, thrives on solving real-world problems, and has a passion for innovative analysis.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Build, train, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to address specific business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide data-driven recommendations.
Design and implement experiments to test hypotheses and optimize business processes.
Present findings and communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with advancements in data science and machine learning techniques to continuously improve analyses.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data science and machine learning tools, such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Strong skills in statistical analysis, data modeling, and predictive analytics.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and ability to convey complex findings clearly.
Excellent problem-solving skills with strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.




Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working arrangements, with remote work options.
Opportunity to work on diverse, impactful projects.
A collaborative environment with a team dedicated to data-driven innovation




If this role sounds like something you would be interested in, Please Apply Now!

Title: Data Contributor in Belgium
Description:
Position: Audio Data Contributor

Project Location: Belgium (Remote)

Engagement Model: One-time task, task based




We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!




What is the project about?

This project aims at collecting text messages, emails, and emails with attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations within the past 2 years.




The collection purpose is to help improve and test features, services, and algorithms by training advanced machine learning systems such as neural networks and generative models.




You can submit personal text messages, emails, and emails with attachments in French (Belgium) from a variety of categories:

Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry);

Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers;

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children’s doctor appointments).




Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and emails with attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.

Compensation

You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.




If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com







***

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Title: Data engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

Are you the Data Engineer who knows how to make a difference by preparing and transforming data from raw data into actionable data that helps create business value? Do you want to contribute to the energy transition with innovative data solutions and help our clients become data-driven organizations?

Your role in our team

At the heart of our efforts to accelerate the energy transition, you will play a vital role as a Data Engineer. Together with customers, colleagues and partners, you work on developing and implementing solutions that are not only technologically advanced, but also smart and sustainable. You do this by working closely together in a multidisciplinary team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Architects. You will contribute to building and maintaining robust data platforms and play a key role in the architectural design of new projects.

Together, you translate the latest trends in both the IT and energy industries into practical and innovative solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals. Your contribution will foster a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration, aimed at achieving the best possible results in our mission to support the energy transition with smart data-driven solutions.

How You Strengthen Our Team

You have a passion for data and innovation and are well-versed in the latest developments in your field. Data is your driving force. You are naturally curious, proactive and easily win others over to your ideas. In addition, you are active in sharing and developing your knowledge within your field. You have an Agile mindset and experience of working in an Agile environment.

Furthermore, we ask:

At least 5Y experience as a Data Engineer with a track record of designing, implementing, and optimizing data solutions.

Strong experience with AWS services such as S3, Athena, Glue, and Redshift, and effective experience in utilizing Databricks, preferably on AWS, for data processing and analytics.

Programming skills in Python, Spark, SQL, or another data engineering language, with the ability to develop and maintain complex data workflows and transformations.

Experience with data processing technologies and frameworks, along with a strong understanding of data architecture principles and best practices.

Knowledge of Agile processes such as Scrum or Kanban, with the ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment.

Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently to deliver high-quality data solutions.

Is a PLUS :

Experience in utilities market / Metering & allocation data management

Knowledge of technical systems like SAP ISU

Familiar with financial closing reports

Native Dutch or French with good communication in English

Education : Bachelor or master degree with a focus on Information Technology, or equivalent

A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

If you are passionate about application onboarding, thrive in a collaborative setting, and are ready to make a strategic impact, apply now and be a part of our team. Your journey towards shaping seamless application integrations starts here!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Consultant Services , Energy and Utilities, , bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
